name: Transcriptional profiling of livers from mice flown on Rodent Research Reference Mission-1 (RRRM-1)
purpose: To assess the effects of spaceflight on liver transcriptional activity in mice, examining the influence of age and the environmental conditions in space compared to ground controls.

groups.treatment: Old mice were flown in space for 22-23 days and sacrificed on-orbit.
groups.results: RNA was extracted from liver samples and processed for transcriptional profiling.

groups.treatment: Young mice were flown in space for 22-23 days and sacrificed on-orbit.
groups.results: RNA was extracted from liver samples and processed for transcriptional profiling.

groups.treatment: Old mice were flown in space for 40 days, returned live to Earth, allowed to recover for 2 days, and then sacrificed.
groups.results: RNA was extracted from liver samples and processed for transcriptional profiling.

groups.treatment: Young mice were flown in space for 40 days, returned live to Earth, allowed to recover for 2 days, and then sacrificed.
groups.results: RNA was extracted from liver samples and processed for transcriptional profiling.

groups.treatment: Old mice housed in flight hardware on Earth under identical environmental conditions to those in space for 22-23 days.
groups.results: RNA was extracted from liver samples and processed for transcriptional profiling.

groups.treatment: Young mice housed in flight hardware on Earth under identical environmental conditions to those in space for 22-23 days.
groups.results: RNA was extracted from liver samples and processed for transcriptional profiling.

groups.treatment: Old mice housed in a vivarium on Earth with standard bedding and food.
groups.results: RNA was extracted from liver samples and processed for transcriptional profiling.

groups.treatment: Young mice housed in a vivarium on Earth with standard bedding and food.
groups.results: RNA was extracted from liver samples and processed for transcriptional profiling.

pre_launch_events.event: Mice were housed and maintained at NASA Kennedy Space Center (KSC) with environmental conditions matching flight habitats.
Mice were placed into spaceflight and habitat ground control transporters.
SpaceX-16 launched with mice aboard for the Rodent Research Reference Mission-1 (RRRM-1).

post_return_events.event: Mice returned to Earth after splashdown in the Pacific Ocean, transported to NASA KSC.
Mice were sacrificed, and liver samples were collected for analysis.
RNA sequencing was performed on liver samples using Illumina NovaSeq 6000.

osdr_experiments.description: Transcriptional profiling of liver samples from prior rodent research missions in space using a similar sequencing platform.

same_subject_experiments.description: Study investigating the effects of spaceflight on liver tissue, focused on the comparison of young and old mice.
